action: Reopens the last tab you've closed. Google Chrome remembers the last 10 tabs you've closed.
Opens the link in the tab.
shortcut: Drag a link to a tab.

action: Returns the tab to its original position.
shortcut: Press Esc while dragging a tab.

action: Maximizes or minimizes the window.
shortcut: Double-click the blank area on the tab strip.

action: Opens a new tab.
Switches to the last tab.
Opens the link in a new tab in the background .
shortcut: Press Ctrl and click a link. Or click a link with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).

action: Opens a new window in incognito mode.
Opens the link in a new window.
shortcut: Press Shift and click a link.

action: Switches to the previous tab.
Closes the current tab or pop-up.
Displays your browsing history in the tab.
shortcut: Right-click, or click and hold either the Back or Forward arrow in the browser toolbar.

action: Closes the tab you clicked.
shortcut: Click a tab with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).

action: Switches to the tab at the specified position number on the tab strip.
Opens a new window.
Opens a file from your computer in Google Chrome.
Goes to the previous page in your browsing history for the tab.
shortcut: Press Alt and the left arrow together.

action: Opens the link in a new tab.
shortcut: Drag a link to a blank area on the tab strip.

action: Opens the tab in the existing window.
shortcut: Drag a tab out of the tab strip and into an existing window.

action: Closes Google Chrome.
Opens the link in a new tab and switches to the newly opened tab.
shortcut: Press Ctrl+Shift and click a link. Or press Shift and click a link with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).

action: Goes to the next page in your browsing history for the tab.
shortcut: Press Alt and the right arrow together.

action: Opens the tab in a new window.
shortcut: Drag a tab out of the tab strip.

action: Switches to the next tab.
Opens the button destination in a new tab in the background.
shortcut: Click either the Back arrow, Forward arrow, or Go button in the toolbar with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).

action: Pastes content from the clipboard.
Deletes the highlighted content and copies it to the clipboard.
Paste content from the clipboard without formatting.
Copies highlighted content to the clipboard.
Reloads your current page.
Downloads the target of the link.
shortcut: Press Alt and click a link.

action: Prints your current page.
Scrolls down the web page.
Finds the previous match for your input in the find bar.
Saves your current page.
Makes everything on the page smaller.
shortcut: Ctrl and -, or press Ctrl and scroll your mousewheel down.

action: Goes to the bottom of the page.
Finds the next match for your input in the find bar.
Saves the link as a bookmark.
shortcut: Drag a link to bookmarks bar

action: Opens the find bar.
Stops the loading of your current page.
Opens the source of your current page.
Goes to the top of the page.
Returns everything on the page to normal size.
Saves all open pages as bookmarks in a new folder.
Saves your current webpage as a bookmark.
Enlarges everything on the page.
shortcut: Ctrl and +, or press Ctrl and scroll your mousewheel up.

action: Opens your page in full-screen mode. Press F11 again to exit full-screen.
Toggles the bookmarks bar on and off.
Switch between multiple users.
Opens the Task Manager.
Opens the Tools menu, which lets you customize and control settings in Google Chrome.
Opens the Help Center in a new tab (our favorite).
Opens Developer Tools.
Opens the History page.
Opens the Clear Browsing Data dialog.
Opens the Downloads page.
Opens the entry in a new tab in the background.
shortcut: Click an entry in the address bar drop-down menu with your middle mouse button (or mousewheel).

action: Selects the first or last entry in the drop-down menu.
shortcut: Press Page Up or Page Down when the address bar drop-down menu is visible.

action: Deletes the key term that precedes your cursor in the address bar
Moves your cursor to the preceding key term in the address bar
shortcut: Press Ctrl+Shift and the left arrow together.

action: Highlights the URL.
Deletes the entry from your browsing history, if possible.
shortcut: Select an entry in the address bar drop-down menu with your keyboard arrows, then press Shift+Delete.

action: Performs a search using your default search engine.
shortcut: Type a search term, then press Enter.

action: Performs a search using the search engine associated with the keyword.
shortcut: Type a search engine keyword, press Space, type a search term, and press Enter.

action: Performs a search using the search engine associated with the URL.
shortcut: Begin typing a search engine URL, press Tab when prompted, type a search term, and press Enter.

action: Moves your cursor to the next key term in the address bar
shortcut: Press Ctrl+Shift and the right arrow together.

action: Places a '?' in the address bar. Type a search term after the question mark to perform a search using your default search engine.
